brief_summary.textblock:
There are two major goals of this project:
1. Comparison of DXA and QCT for diagnosis of bone loss in CKD-5 patients and determination of the prevalence of low bone turnover in CKD-5 patients with bone loss.
2. Identification of the optimal combination of noninvasive tests for definition of the turnover component of ROD.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of DXA and QCT for diagnosis of bone loss in CKD-5 patients and determination of the prevalence of low bone turnover in CKD-5 patients with bone loss.
primary_outcome.description: Because each method (QCT or DXA) yields a dichotomous response (bone loss: yes or no), the proportion of patients with a bone loss will be compared between the 2 methods by using the McNemar statistic for correlated proportions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Identification of the optimal combination of noninvasive tests for definition of the turnover component of ROD.
secondary_outcome.description: A stepwise logistic model will be used to determine which combination of PTH and bone markers best predicts low bone turnover.
